member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundTransfer.TransferPreferences.AllowCellular
member.summary: Allow transfers when the device is connected to external power and has a Wi-Fi or cellular connection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundTransfer.TransferPreferences.AllowBattery
member.summary: Allow transfers when there is a Wi-Fi connection and the device is using battery or external power.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundTransfer.TransferPreferences.AllowCellularAndBattery
member.summary: Allow transfers when the device is using battery or external power and has a Wi-Fi or cellular connection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundTransfer.TransferStatus
member.summary: Defines the list of states that a background transfer request can be.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundTransfer.TransferStatus.None
member.summary: The request has not yet been queued.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundTransfer.TransferStatus.Transferring
member.summary: The requested file is currently being transferred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundTransfer.TransferStatus.Waiting
member.summary: The request is waiting in the background transfer service queue. This status can indicate that the request is queued and waiting for previous transfers to complete or that the service is retrying the request due to a network error.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundTransfer.TransferStatus.WaitingForWiFi
member.summary: The request is waiting in the background transfer service queue for a Wi-Fi connection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundTransfer.TransferStatus.WaitingForExternalPower
member.summary: The request is waiting in the background transfer service queue for external power to be connected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundTransfer.TransferStatus.WaitingForExternalPowerDueToBatterySaverMode
member.summary: The request is waiting for the device to be connected to external power because the user has enabled Battery Saver mode on the device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundTransfer.TransferStatus.WaitingForNonVoiceBlockingNetwork
member.summary: The background transfer service does not run when the device is on a non-simultaneous voice and data network, including 2G, EDGE, and standard GPRS. This status indicates the service is waiting for a supported network connection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundTransfer.TransferStatus.Paused
member.summary: The request has been paused and waiting in the background transfer service queue.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundTransfer.TransferStatus.Completed
member.summary: The request has completed. This means that the request is no longer actionable by the background transfer service regardless of whether the transfer was completed successfully. To confirm that a transfer was successful, confirm that the property is null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundTransfer.TransferStatus.Unknown
member.summary: The background transfer service could not retrieve the request status from the service. Once in this state, a object is no longer useable. You may attempt to retrieve a new instance using the method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Phone.Controls.ObscuredEventArgs.IsLocked
member.summary: This property returns the phone lock state.
member.returns: Returns . true to indicate that the phone is locked; false to indicate that the phone is unlocked. If you have set the property to Disabled, your application will run underneath the lock screen. If the IsLocked property is set to true, for better performance, turn off all UI functionality because it cannot be viewed. The application should stop all operations that are not critical, such as animations, media, or sensors.

member.summary: The Push Client and the Microsoft Push Notification Service are disconnected.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelErrorType
member.summary: An enumeration that contains asynchronous errors sent from the Push Client to the application. These error values can occur regardless of whether the application is running in the foreground or not.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelErrorType.ChannelOpenFailed
member.summary: This error is returned when the Push Client and the Push Notification Service are unable to establish a connection. For more information about push notifications, see Push notifications for Windows Phone.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelErrorType.PayloadFormatError
member.summary: This error is returned when the XML payload format or the HTTP header of the push notification is syntactically invalid. When this error is returned, the HTTP channel is disconnected and the channel must be reopened.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelErrorType.MessageBadContent
member.summary: This error is returned when the image reference is pointing to an HTTP image, even though the notification channel is not currently bound to a list of URIs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelErrorType.NotificationRateTooHigh
member.summary: This error is returned when the Push Client is unable to receive messages because the web service is sending too many messages at too quick a rate to a certain device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelErrorType.PowerLevelChanged
member.summary: This error is returned when the Push Client's power policy changes due to a change in battery level.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelErrorType.Unknown
member.summary: This error is returned when an unknown error occurs.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelPowerLevel

member.summary: The battery capacity is not low. All push notification types will be sent to the device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelPowerLevel.LowPowerLevel
member.summary: The battery capacity is low. Only raw notifications will be sent to the device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelPowerLevel.CriticalLowPowerLevel
member.summary: The battery capacity is critically low. No push notifications of any type will be sent to the device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Scheduler.AgentExitReason.None
member.summary: The agent has never been executed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Scheduler.AgentExitReason.Completed
member.summary: The agent exited by calling NotifyComplete. An agent should always call this method when it has completed its intended task.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Scheduler.AgentExitReason.Aborted
member.summary: The agent exited by calling the Abort method. After this method is called, the property will be set to false and the agent will not be run again unless the foreground application reschedules it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Scheduler.AgentExitReason.MemoryQuotaExceeded
member.summary: The agent was terminated by the system because it exceeded the memory cap for background agents.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Scheduler.AgentExitReason.ExecutionTimeExceeded
member.summary: The agent was terminated by the system because the allotted time for execution has been exceeded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Scheduler.AgentExitReason.UnhandledException
member.summary: The agent was terminated because an unhandled exception occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Scheduler.AgentExitReason.Terminated
member.summary: The agent was terminated by the system due to the state of the device or operating system.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Scheduler.AgentExitReason.Other
member.summary: An internal system error caused the agent to be terminated.
